text:
Had the signature dried mee pok. The noodle is cooked al dante which I like. Chilli sauce is nice and this bowl comes with quite a lot of ingredients. Apart from minced meat, you get pig liver, mushroom slices, imitation abalone slices and lettuce. The soup is tasty.
Service is acceptable.

This stall is located inside rivercourt koufu. Their laska is decent, Comes with some bean spouts, cockles is fresh but small, half a hard boiled egg and 2 pieces of tau pok. Not something I will travel to eat.

Fill your tummy Ba Cho Mee. Own by local cook by Vietnamese.  Noodles bouncy , however the ratio of watery sauce to noodles a little too wet . Ingredients a plenty yet little in comparison.  A lot of variety to choose from is a plus. Price is food court pricing.
A so so BCM.

Don't try, uncle who cook the noodle there wash the table clothes using the compartment next to

where he cooks the noodle n the soup base of the food. Hygienice failed badly.

I ordered from the app and waited until the app showed it’s ready for collection. Then, when I went to collect but staff asked me to go and queue. When it was my turn, the uncle told me to read out my order out loud so it can be done faster (apparently they don’t even bother to check my online order).

you might as well just remove yourself from koufu app?
